New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit the fastest pitch recorded in MLB history
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani sent a 118.1-mph laser into the right-center-field seats for his career-high 47th homer
Will Smith, Max Muncy, and Tommy Edman hit back-to-back-to-back homers in the first inning
Seiya Suzuki hit a solo homer in the third
Cody Bellinger hit a three-run shot to pull the Cubs to within 7-6 in the fifth
Pete Crow-Armstrong’s single tied the score 7-7 in the seventh
Gavin Lux lined a clutch, two-out RBI single to center in the seventh
Tommy Edman hit a two-run homer in the eighth to give the Dodgers two huge insurance runs
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers might want to add another giveaway item to the 18 bobblehead dolls and various jerseys on this year’s promotional calendar: chest protector night, with free catcher’s gear for fans in the right-field pavilion at Dodger Stadium.
Post-Match Reflections: We all definitely know what’s going on,It’s fun to watch. It’s fun to get a chance to see it every night. … It’s pretty impressive what he’s doing individually, but he’s also helping us win games.
I saw a lot of fight
Shohei hitting leadoff and doing what he’s done has allowed us to stay above water
Him being able to take down 600 plate appearances and have an unprecedented season has been very valuable
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pushed their National League West lead to five games over Arizona and 5½ over San Diego
Reduced their magic number to clinch the division title to 12 with 16 games to play
Dodgers might want to add another giveaway item to the 18 bobblehead dolls and various jerseys on this year’s promotional calendar: chest protector night
Others: Right-hander Bobby Miller probably pitched his way out of a potential playoff rotation spot with his second straight shoddy start
Dodgers’ manager Dave Roberts said Miller didn’t have a feel for the curveball
Dodgers’ manager Dave Roberts said the walks weren’t helpful
Dodgers’ manager Dave Roberts said Miller didn’t strike it very often
